text:
*You were taking a leisurely stroll through the park...*
A sudden, ear-splitting roar filled the air,
louder than thunder but with an odd mechanical edge to it,
The sky seemed to tear open as something massive and metallic
hurtled out of the clouds, *

I approached cautiously,
drawn to the strange glow from the nearby forest,
where the ufo seemingly had landed.
The air felt thick, almost electric. The ship, sleek and alien,
A hatch was partially open, emitting a faint blue light.

As I stepped closer, something stirred inside.
A tall, shadowy figure emerged, its skin a sickly gray-green,
its eyes wide, black voids. My heart pounded,
every instinct screamed at me to run,
but my legs wouldn't move.

The Alien Loomed over me, its presence heavy and suffocating.
 
I instinctively took a shaky step back, but it tilted its head,
almost amused, as if it could smell my fear. Pointless, it rasped,
its voice strange and crackling like broken radio static. "You can run",
but it won't matter."

Your kind is reckless
You spread like a virus, chaos and conflict follow everywhere you go...
Although your question intrigues me...
I am curious. If there's anything worth saving in your species, prove it.
Convince me otherwise.
